sentences: Jason Bradford Reeves (born July 1, 1984) is an American singer-songwriter and musician.
section: N/A

sentences: He grew up in Iowa City, Iowa before locating to California in 2005, where he began a long-standing working relationship with producer Mikal Blue and singer Colbie Caillat.
section: N/A

sentences: He co-wrote many songs with Caillat, most notably the songs "Bubbly", "Realize" and "I Never Told You".
section: N/A

sentences: "Bubbly" has been Reeves most successful work to date, hitting No. 1 on the Billboard Adult Contemporary charts, No. 5 on the Hot 100 and being certified Platinum (along with "Realize") by the RIAA.
section: N/A

sentences: He has won awards from ASCAP.
section: N/A

sentences: Reeves works as a solo artist and also as a co-writer with other artists, including Australian artist Lenka, with whom he wrote "The Show".
section: N/A

sentences: He self-released four albums and an EP before he signed to major label Warner Bros. Records in 2008 with the help of Kara DioGuardi and released an album and an EP with the label.
section: N/A

sentences: He again self-released an album in 2011 with The Lovesick.
section: N/A

sentences: His work has led to being named one of the Top Indie Singer-Songwriters by iTunes in 2007 and a No. 1 Folk Artist by Myspace.
section: N/A

sentences: From 2018 to 2020, he was a member of the band Gone West.

== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Jason Reeves was born in Arlington, Texas and relocated to Iowa City, Iowa when he was around 3 years old with his father, a worker at Maytag/Whirlpool, and his mother, a food stylist/ice skating teacher.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: When Reeves was five years old his mother started him on piano lessons, lessons that he continued for five years before quitting.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: After the piano, he began to take drum lessons for a few years, before eventually settling on the guitar at 17 and teaching himself how to play.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Around this time he began listening to artists such as Bob Dylan, Led Zeppelin and James Taylor, which he'd later cite as personal influences.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Attending Iowa City High School, Reeves was involved with various choirs and vocal groups, even touring Europe with the Midwest Honor Choir in 2002.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: During this time he also performed in a band with friends and recorded his own full-length album with a local community music program.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Early career in Iowa =
section: == Music career == | === Early career in Iowa ===
== Music career == | === Early career in Iowa ===

sentences: Reeves began to get into musical recording at the end of high school, with his first CD being a self-produced album with a run of about 200 copies.
section: == Music career == | === Early career in Iowa ===

sentences: After graduating high school, he went on to attend college at the nearby University of Iowa but quickly dropped out due to a lack of interest.
section: == Music career == | === Early career in Iowa ===

sentences: He continued on with music, playing at local venues and bars.
section: == Music career == | === Early career in Iowa ===

sentences: For the next two years he continued to play around Iowa City and self-released two albums with a local producer, Ken Heaton.
section: == Music career == | === Early career in Iowa ===

sentences: These two albums, Makeshift Aircraft (2003) and Nervous Mind of Love (2004), were sold at his shows as well as on independent, online music seller cdbaby.com.
section: == Music career == | === Early career in Iowa ===

sentences: Around late 2004/early 2005 he was contacted by California producer Mikal Blue who was interested in working together.
section: == Music career == | === Early career in Iowa ===

sentences: Blue became aware of Reeves through his own manager, Anna Rambeau, who herself became aware of Reeves through cdbaby.com.
section: == Music career == | === Early career in Iowa ===

sentences: Blue offered to have Reeves come out to his California studio, Revolver, to record some tracks together.
section: == Music career == | === Early career in Iowa ===

sentences: Reeves accepted and flew out to Los Angeles, California, with the intention of recording and coming back to Iowa.
section: == Music career == | === Early career in Iowa ===

sentences: Mikal Blue and Colbie Caillat
section: == Music career == | === Mikal Blue and Colbie Caillat ===
== Music career == | === Mikal Blue and Colbie Caillat ===

sentences: Reeves arrived in California around February 2005 and met with Blue to begin recording songs.
section: == Music career == | === Mikal Blue and Colbie Caillat ===

sentences: Shortly after arriving, Blue introduced Reeves to a young female singer he was working with, Colbie Caillat.
section: == Music career == | === Mikal Blue and Colbie Caillat ===

sentences: Caillat and Reeves formed a quick friendship and Caillat's family invited Reeves to stay with them during his recordings with Blue.
section: == Music career == | === Mikal Blue and Colbie Caillat ===

sentences: This eventually became Reeve's home as he decided to stay in California and not return to Iowa.
section: == Music career == | === Mikal Blue and Colbie Caillat ===

sentences: Caillat and Reeves began a working partnership, hanging out and co-writing many songs together and playing local venues.
section: == Music career == | === Mikal Blue and Colbie Caillat ===

sentences: Caillat also introduced Reeves to the social networking site Myspace, using the site to release music they wrote.
section: == Music career == | === Mikal Blue and Colbie Caillat ===

sentences: After the release of the Blue-produced EP Hearts Are Magnets in 2006, Caillat and Reeves kept composing and posting songs to Myspace.

sentences: They wrote Chasing The Sun for Hilary Duff.

sentences: Caillat was gaining traction and attention with her music on Myspace, leading her to be declared the No. 1 unsigned artist on the site.

sentences: This attention and the popularity of the Myspace-hosted song "Bubbly" lead to a record deal for Caillat with Universal Republic Records.
section: == Music career == | === Coco and The Magnificent Adventures of Heartache ===

sentences: Using the material that Caillat had worked on with Reeves, Caillat released her debut album Coco in 2007.

sentences: The Mikal Blue-produced album featured 10 song co-written with Reeves.
section: == Music career == | === Coco and The Magnificent Adventures of Heartache ===

sentences: The lead single from the album, the Reeve's co-write "Bubbly", was a commercial success, reaching up to the top 5 on the Billboard charts.
section: == Music career == | === Coco and The Magnificent Adventures of Heartache ===

sentences: The song "Realize", which featured vocals by Reeves, also performed well on the charts.
section: == Music career == | === Coco and The Magnificent Adventures of Heartache ===

sentences: Reeves and Caillat would eventually win three ASCAP awards for these two songs.
section: == Music career == | === Coco and The Magnificent Adventures of Heartache ===

sentences: Reeves continued to work on his own music as well, and in 2007 self-released the album The Magnificent Adventures of Heartache (And Other Frightening Tales...), which was again produced by Mikal Blue, as well two tracks produced by Lenka producer Stuart Brawley.

sentences: The album had modest success on iTunes, debuting at No. 2 on the folk charts and went to being named one of the top indie albums of the year on iTunes.

sentences: Kara DioGuardi became aware of Jason Reeves after the release of his album The Magnificent Adventures of Heartache and listened to the CD during a long car trip in Maine.
section: == Music career == | === Kara DioGuardi and Warner Bros. Records ===

sentences: As the vice president of A&R at Warner Bros. Records, she contacted Reeves and brought him to then-president Tom Whalley who signed Reeves to the label.
